meanings.definition: A small, hard seed found in some fruits.
meanings.sent1: The bird cracked open the avels to get to the tasty seed inside.
meanings.sent2: I found a few avels in the apple I was eating.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored the avels in its secret stash for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The avels scattered on the ground, waiting to sprout into new plants.
meanings.sent5: The avels were so tiny, they were easy to miss among the fallen leaves.

meanings.definition: The act of moving quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: She rushed through the crowd with the avels of a deer.
meanings.sent2: The avels of the children echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent3: The avels of the wind made the trees sway back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The avels of the river carried the boat downstream in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The avels of the car racing by startled the pedestrians on the sidewalk.

meanings.sent1: After finishing his work, he liked to avels around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The cat avels around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent3: She would often avels through the park, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent4: The clouds avels lazily across the sky on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The thoughts in his mind would avels from one idea to another, never settling.
